page.title: 10EPPLETON COLLIERY
page.content: In case of accidents men are trained at the{Miners Rescue Station} for rescue work in coal mines. Dangers can arise from fire, poisonous or explosive gases and flooding. Breathing apparatus is stored and checked in the proto room; we tried on the apparatus and it was very heavy. Under the rescue station at Houghton are{galleries}where low dark tunnels and wooden dummies which the men carry on stretchers make it seem like the real thing. We explored here wearing safety helmets and lights. {Canaries}are bred in the station and are still used to detect poisonous gas. In the{duty room}are maps, plans of each coal-mine, served by the station and telephones which are always manned ready for any appeals for{help}to be answered.
